Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2011 09:38PM Rain555 wrote: I have it, too.  Lumpectomy,no problems. No chemo. Did radiation and then started Arimidex (Anastrozole).  Two weeks later I started waking with hand pain, numbness.  Now occurs during the day as well.  It's a stinging pain, not easily ignored. My fingers are warm but swollen, arm is not swollen.   Can't feel the keyboard.  It comes and goes and I'm trying to log so I can pin down the variables.
Posts.Title: Hand numbness one year after mastectomy momofcuig Shrek4

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2011 11:36PM Rain555 wrote: Marilyn, being diagnosed is tough and kind of unreal.  It will get better from here.  I'm a few months past diagnosis, into treatment, and this is a good website.  I find better answers here than the handouts from my oncologist.  My thoughts are with you.
Posts.Title: N.S Girl just diagnosed in Calgary MarilynL pickle
